intro: Lampranthus arbuthnotiae, commonly known as the Orange River Carpet, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its diverse array of flowering plants, many of which are adapted to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, ribbed stems and produces vibrant orange to yellow flowers during the winter months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
